list_page_teaser: Not everyone who runs for president wins.  See the images of several recent contenders for this office who did not win, and compare them to the images of the winners in the Presidents gallery.
description_html: These are images of some candidates who have recently run for President of the United States and lost.
story_html:
Did one of your favorite candidates recently lose a presidential election? If so, was their personality type more similar to yours than the winner?

Or do you think this personality type stuff is irrelevant to your politics? Perhaps your voting habits are based strictly a candidate's political party, or their ideology or stance on a specific issue that has nothing to do with these preferences?

My hope is that sharing these images will help you answer these questions for yourself!

image_list.title: Hillary Clinton
image_list.subtitle_html: Presidential Contender
image_list.story_html: This article at slate.com claims that Hillary is an ESTJ: http://www.slate.com/id/2184696/ , and this seems reasonable and believable.  The Green represents her Logical decision-making and the Yellow represents her Pragmatic views.  These traits are evident in her reliability, devotion, attention to detail, and willingness to take charge.

image_list.title: John McCain
image_list.subtitle_html: Presidential Contender
image_list.story_html: This article at Slate claims that John McCain is an ESTP: http://www.slate.com/id/2184696/ , and that sounds reasonable and believable to us.  The Yellow represents his Pragmatic views and the Green represents his Logical decision making.  Both of these traits are evident in his practicality and willingness to take risks.

image_list.title: Ralph Nader
image_list.subtitle_html: Presidential Contender
image_list.story_html: According to keirsey.com, Ralph Nader is an ENFJ.  The Blue in the image represents his Idealism, and the Red represents his Emotional decision making.  These traits are evident in his political views, such as his hope for the future and concern for people.
